page.title: 07ROADS AND TRAFFIC
page.content: The main road going through Chipping Warden is the A361 which starts in Daventry and goes all the way down to Ilracombe in Devon. Quite a lot of lorries go through or to Chipping Warden because there is an industrial estate along Appletree Road. It is called Appletree Road because it goes to a place called Appletree. At this Industrial estate there are three companies, Lowfield, E.P.S. and House of Holland. Some farm vehicles go through Chipping Warden because there are several farms nearby. In the middle of the village there used to be an elm tree. The A361 was built round this tree and is now a dangerous bend. There have been many accidents on this bend. The tree died,was cut down but the bend in the road is still there. Perhaps a by-pass will be built to stop this busy road from spoiling our lovely village.
